results.title: Canada taps into U.S. military satellites for mobile communications
results.summary: Canada is the first international partner to access the U.S. Mobile User Objective System (MUOS) satellite network, the U.S. Space Force announced Nov. 30.

results.title: SpaceX Ready To Test Starlink Direct To Cell Service
results.summary: In an FCC filing made this week SpaceX is seeking "special temporary authority" to commence testing of there Starlink Direct To Cell service on December 10, with a testing period lasting 180 days.

results.title: Intelsat To Bring OneWeb Internet To Regional American Airlines Jets
results.summary: American Airlines has revealed plans to outfit nearly 500 regional jets starting in 2024 with their cutting-edge multi-orbit Wi-Fi connectivity provided by Intelsat.

results.title: Angola Signs Artemis Accords
results.summary: Angola officially signed the Artemis Accords on November 30, solidifying its commitment to best practices in space exploration.

results.title: Angola signs Artemis Accords
results.summary: Angola signed the U.S.-led Artemis Accords outlining best practices for space exploration Nov. 30, becoming the third African nation to do so.

results.title: GAO: 2025 Unlikely for First Artemis Lunar Landing, Maybe 2027
results.summary: The Government Accountability Office’s latest report on NASA’s Artemis program is skeptical that the agency can return astronauts to the lunar surface in 2025, the current plan. If development of […]

results.title: NASA Researchers Authorized To Apply For China's Moon Samples
results.summary: In a surprising turn of events, NASA-funded researchers have been given the green light to apply for access to lunar samples collected by China's Chang'e-5 mission, marking a rare exception to the longstanding prohibition on bilateral activities between the two space agencies.

results.title: Amazon adds Falcon 9 to multi-billion-dollar Project Kuiper launch campaign
results.summary: Amazon has signed a contract with SpaceX to launch an unspecified number of satellites for its Project Kuiper broadband constellation on three Falcon 9 rockets from mid-2025.

results.title: ESA sets launch date for Ariane 6 for summer of 2024
results.summary: The long-awaited maiden flight of Ariane 6 is scheduled to take place between June 15 and July 31, 2024, European Space Agency (ESA) Director General Josef Aschbacher announced at a press conference on Thursday.

results.title: Amazon buys SpaceX rocket launches for Kuiper satellite internet project
results.summary: Amazon bought three rocket launches from SpaceX for its Project Kuiper internet satellites, the tech giant announced on Friday.

results.title: SpaceX To Launch Amazon Project Kuiper Satellites In 2025
results.summary: Amazon has inked a deal with SpaceX for three Falcon 9 launches with the missions scheduled to commence in mid-2025.

results.title: How to stop Europe’s space sector from lagging behind in defense
results.summary: Europe has power, influence and a huge economy — so why is it lagging behind in defense?
